attributes.action: Stop giving MP's pay rises or bonuses until they meet publicly stated targets.
attributes.additional_details: You work for us, as elected members of a democracy. One definition of democracy is "the practice or principles of social equality". Most work hard for a pay rise showing leadership, initiative and generally work harder than previously done to do so among other outstanding actions... can anyone explain why this is repeated year on year after putting their interests first. You are not practicing social equality, to EARN a pay rise actionable targets must be stated and met, like any other job.
attributes.background:
An increase of 2.7% in 2019, 1.8% 2018, 1.4% 2017, 1.3% 2016 and a £7K increase in 2015 for doing their job inadequately.
Bring academics into parliament to correct cherry-picked "facts", recommended topics, drugs, knife crime, NHS, pollution, women's rights, homelessness the list goes on...

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
